line: What's he that hath so much thy place mistook

speaker: KING LEAR
line: To set thee here?

speaker: KENT
line: It is both he and she;

speaker: KENT
line: Your son and daughter.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: No.

speaker: KENT
line: Yes.

speaker: KING LEAR
line: No, I say.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: I say, yea.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: No, no, they would not.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Yes, they have.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: By Juno, I swear, ay.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: They durst not do 't;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: They could not, would not do 't; 'tis worse than murder,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: To do upon respect such violent outrage:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Resolve me, with all modest haste, which way

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Thou mightst deserve, or they impose, this usage,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Coming from us.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: My lord, when at their home

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: I did commend your highness' letters to them,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Ere I was risen from the place that show'd

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: My duty kneeling, came there a reeking post,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: Stew'd in his haste, half breathless, panting forth

speaker: KENT
line: From Goneril his mistress salutations;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Deliver'd letters, spite of intermission,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Which presently they read: on whose contents,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: They summon'd up their meiny, straight took horse;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Commanded me to follow, and attend

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: The leisure of their answer; gave me cold looks:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: And meeting here the other messenger,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Whose welcome, I perceived, had poison'd mine,--

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Being the very fellow that of late

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Display'd so saucily against your highness,--

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Having more man than wit about me, drew:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: He raised the house with loud and coward cries.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Your son and daughter found this trespass worth

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: The shame which here it suffers.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: Winter's not gone yet, if the wild-geese fly that way.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: Fathers that wear rags

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: Do make their children blind;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: But fathers that bear bags

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: Shall see their children kind.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: Fortune, that arrant whore,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: Ne'er turns the key to the poor.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: But, for all this, thou shalt have as many dolours

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: for thy daughters as thou canst tell in a year.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: O, how this mother swells up toward my heart!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Hysterica passio, down, thou climbing sorrow,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Thy element's below! Where is this daughter?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: With the earl, sir, here within.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Follow me not;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Stay here.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Gentleman
line: Made you no more offence but what you speak of?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: None.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: How chance the king comes with so small a train?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: And thou hadst been set i' the stocks for that

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: question, thou hadst well deserved it.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Why, fool?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: We'll set thee to school to an ant, to teach thee

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: there's no labouring i' the winter. All that follow

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: their noses are led by their eyes but blind men; and

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: there's not a nose among twenty but can smell him

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: that's stinking. Let go thy hold when a great wheel

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: runs down a hill, lest it break thy neck with

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: following it: but the great one that goes up the

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: hill, let him draw thee after. When a wise man

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: gives thee better counsel, give me mine again: I

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: would have none but knaves follow it, since a fool gives it.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: That sir which serves and seeks for gain,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: And follows but for form,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: Will pack when it begins to rain,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: And leave thee in the storm,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: But I will tarry; the fool will stay,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: And let the wise man fly:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: The knave turns fool that runs away;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: The fool no knave, perdy.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KENT
line: Where learned you this, fool?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: Not i' the stocks, fool.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Deny to speak with me? They are sick? they are weary?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: They have travell'd all the night? Mere fetches;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: The images of revolt and flying off.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Fetch me a better answer.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: My dear lord,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: You know the fiery quality of the duke;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: How unremoveable and fix'd he is

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: In his own course.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Vengeance! plague! death! confusion!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Fiery? what quality? Why, Gloucester, Gloucester,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I'ld speak with the Duke of Cornwall and his wife.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Well, my good lord, I have inform'd them so.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Inform'd them! Dost thou understand me, man?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ay, my good lord.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: The king would speak with Cornwall; the dear father

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Would with his daughter speak, commands her service:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Are they inform'd of this? My breath and blood!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Fiery? the fiery duke? Tell the hot duke that--

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: No, but not yet: may be he is not well:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Infirmity doth still neglect all office

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Whereto our health is bound; we are not ourselves

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: When nature, being oppress'd, commands the mind

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: To suffer with the body: I'll forbear;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: And am fall'n out with my more headier will,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: To take the indisposed and sickly fit

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: For the sound man. Death on my state! wherefore

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Should he sit here? This act persuades me

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: That this remotion of the duke and her

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Is practise only. Give me my servant forth.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Go tell the duke and 's wife I'ld speak with them,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Now, presently: bid them come forth and hear me,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: Or at their chamber-door I'll beat the drum

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Till it cry sleep to death.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I would have all well betwixt you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: O me, my heart, my rising heart! but, down!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: Fool
line: Cry to it, nuncle, as the cockney did to the eels

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

speaker: Fool
line: kindness to his horse, buttered his hay.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: Hail to your grace!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: I am glad to see your highness.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: Regan, I think you are; I know what reason

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: I have to think so: if thou shouldst not be glad,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: I would divorce me from thy mother's tomb,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Sepulchring an adultress.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: O, are you free?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Some other time for that. Beloved Regan,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Thy sister's naught: O Regan, she hath tied

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Sharp-tooth'd unkindness, like a vulture, here:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I can scarce speak to thee; thou'lt not believe

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: With how depraved a quality--O Regan!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: I pray you, sir, take patience: I have hope.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: You less know how to value her desert

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Than she to scant her duty.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Say, how is that?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: I cannot think my sister in the least

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: Would fail her obligation: if, sir, perchance

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: She have restrain'd the riots of your followers,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: 'Tis on such ground, and to such wholesome end,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: As clears her from all blame.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: My curses on her!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: O, sir, you are old.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Nature in you stands on the very verge

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Of her confine: you should be ruled and led

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: By some discretion, that discerns your state

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Better than you yourself. Therefore, I pray you,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: That to our sister you do make return;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Say you have wrong'd her, sir.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Ask her forgiveness?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Do you but mark how this becomes the house:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: 'Dear daughter, I confess that I am old;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Age is unnecessary: on my knees I beg

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: That you'll vouchsafe me raiment, bed, and food.'

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Good sir, no more; these are unsightly tricks:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Return you to my sister.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Rising  Never, Regan:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: She hath abated me of half my train;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Look'd black upon me; struck me with her tongue,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: Most serpent-like, upon the very heart:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: All the stored vengeances of heaven fall

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: On her ingrateful top! Strike her young bones,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: You taking airs, with lameness!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: CORNWALL
line: Fie, sir, fie!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: You nimble lightnings, dart your blinding flames

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: Into her scornful eyes! Infect her beauty,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: You fen-suck'd fogs, drawn by the powerful sun,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: To fall and blast her pride!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: O the blest gods! so will you wish on me,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: When the rash mood is on.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: No, Regan, thou shalt never have my curse:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Thy tender-hefted nature shall not give

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Thee o'er to harshness: her eyes are fierce; but thine

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Do comfort and not burn. 'Tis not in thee

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: To grudge my pleasures, to cut off my train,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: To bandy hasty words, to scant my sizes,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: And in conclusion to oppose the bolt

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: Against my coming in: thou better know'st

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: The offices of nature, bond of childhood,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: Effects of courtesy, dues of gratitude;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: Wherein I thee endow'd.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Good sir, to the purpose.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Who put my man i' the stocks?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: CORNWALL
line: What trumpet's that?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: I know't, my sister's: this approves her letter,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: That she would soon be here.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Is your lady come?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: This is a slave, whose easy-borrow'd pride

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Dwells in the fickle grace of her he follows.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Out, varlet, from my sight!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: CORNWALL
line: What means your grace?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Who stock'd my servant? Regan, I have good hope

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Thou didst not know on't. Who comes here? O heavens,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: If you do love old men, if your sweet sway

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Allow obedience, if yourselves are old,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Make it your cause; send down, and take my part!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Art not ashamed to look upon this beard?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: O Regan, wilt thou take her by the hand?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: Why not by the hand, sir? How have I offended?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: All's not offence that indiscretion finds

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: And dotage terms so.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: O sides, you are too tough;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Will you yet hold? How came my man i' the stocks?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: CORNWALL
line: I set him there, sir: but his own disorders

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: CORNWALL
line: Deserved much less advancement.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: You! did you?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: I pray you, father, being weak, seem so.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: If, till the expiration of your month,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: You will return and sojourn with my sister,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Dismissing half your train, come then to me:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: I am now from home, and out of that provision

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Which shall be needful for your entertainment.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Return to her, and fifty men dismiss'd?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: No, rather I abjure all roofs, and choose

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: To wage against the enmity o' the air;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: To be a comrade with the wolf and owl,--

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Necessity's sharp pinch! Return with her?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Why, the hot-blooded France, that dowerless took

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Our youngest born, I could as well be brought

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: To knee his throne, and, squire-like; pension beg

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: To keep base life afoot. Return with her?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Persuade me rather to be slave and sumpter

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: To this detested groom.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: At your choice, sir.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I prithee, daughter, do not make me mad:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I will not trouble thee, my child; farewell:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: We'll no more meet, no more see one another:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: But yet thou art my flesh, my blood, my daughter;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Or rather a disease that's in my flesh,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Which I must needs call mine: thou art a boil,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: A plague-sore, an embossed carbuncle,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: In my corrupted blood. But I'll not chide thee;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Let shame come when it will, I do not call it:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I do not bid the thunder-bearer shoot,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Nor tell tales of thee to high-judging Jove:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Mend when thou canst; be better at thy leisure:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I can be patient; I can stay with Regan,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I and my hundred knights.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Not altogether so:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: I look'd not for you yet, nor am provided

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: For your fit welcome. Give ear, sir, to my sister;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: For those that mingle reason with your passion

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Must be content to think you old, and so--

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: But she knows what she does.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Is this well spoken?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: I dare avouch it, sir: what, fifty followers?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Is it not well? What should you need of more?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Yea, or so many, sith that both charge and danger

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Speak 'gainst so great a number? How, in one house,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Should many people, under two commands,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Hold amity? 'Tis hard; almost impossible.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: Why might not you, my lord, receive attendance

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: From those that she calls servants or from mine?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Why not, my lord? If then they chanced to slack you,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: We could control them. If you will come to me,--

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: For now I spy a danger,--I entreat you

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: To bring but five and twenty: to no more

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Will I give place or notice.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I gave you all--

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: And in good time you gave it.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Made you my guardians, my depositaries;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: But kept a reservation to be follow'd

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: With such a number. What, must I come to you

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: With five and twenty, Regan? said you so?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: And speak't again, my lord; no more with me.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Those wicked creatures yet do look well-favour'd,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: When others are more wicked: not being the worst

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Stands in some rank of praise.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I'll go with thee:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Thy fifty yet doth double five and twenty,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: And thou art twice her love.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: Hear me, my lord;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: What need you five and twenty, ten, or five,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: To follow in a house where twice so many

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: Have a command to tend you?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: What need one?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: O, reason not the need: our basest beggars

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Are in the poorest thing superfluous:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Allow not nature more than nature needs,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Man's life's as cheap as beast's: thou art a lady;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: If only to go warm were gorgeous,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Why, nature needs not what thou gorgeous wear'st,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Which scarcely keeps thee warm. But, for true need,--

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: You heavens, give me that patience, patience I need!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: You see me here, you gods, a poor old man,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: As full of grief as age; wretched in both!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: If it be you that stir these daughters' hearts

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Against their father, fool me not so much

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: To bear it tamely; touch me with noble anger,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: And let not women's weapons, water-drops,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Stain my man's cheeks! No, you unnatural hags,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I will have such revenges on you both,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: That all the world shall--I will do such things,--

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: What they are, yet I know not: but they shall be

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: The terrors of the earth. You think I'll weep

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: No, I'll not weep:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I have full cause of weeping; but this heart

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Shall break into a hundred thousand flaws,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Or ere I'll weep. O fool, I shall go mad!

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: CORNWALL
line: Let us withdraw; 'twill be a storm.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: This house is little: the old man and his people

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Cannot be well bestow'd.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: 'Tis his own blame; hath put himself from rest,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: And must needs taste his folly.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: For his particular, I'll receive him gladly,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: But not one follower.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: So am I purposed.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: Where is my lord of Gloucester?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: CORNWALL
line: Follow'd the old man forth: he is return'd.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The king is in high rage.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: CORNWALL
line: Whither is he going?

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: He calls to horse; but will I know not whither.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: CORNWALL
line: 'Tis best to give him way; he leads himself.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GONERIL
line: My lord, entreat him by no means to stay.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Alack, the night comes on, and the bleak winds

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Do sorely ruffle; for many miles about

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.

line: There's scarce a bush.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: O, sir, to wilful men,

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: The injuries that they themselves procure

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: Must be their schoolmasters. Shut up your doors:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: He is attended with a desperate train;

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: And what they may incense him to, being apt

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: REGAN
line: To have his ear abused, wisdom bids fear.

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: CORNWALL
line: Shut up your doors, my lord; 'tis a wild night:

scene: SCENE IV.  Before GLOUCESTER's castle. KENT in the stocks.
speaker: CORNWALL
line: My Regan counsels well; come out o' the storm.

line: What it contains. If you shall see Cordelia,--

line: As fear not but you shall,--show her this ring;

line: You cataracts and hurricanoes, spout

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.

line: You sulphurous and thought-executing fires,

line: Vaunt-couriers to oak-cleaving thunderbolts,

line: O nuncle, court holy-water in a dry

line: Nor rain, wind, thunder, fire, are my daughters:

line: I tax not you, you elements, with unkindness;

line: I never gave you kingdom, call'd you children,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: You owe me no subscription: then let fall

line: Your horrible pleasure: here I stand, your slave,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: A poor, infirm, weak, and despised old man:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.

line: But yet I call you servile ministers,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.

line: That have with two pernicious daughters join'd

line: Your high engender'd battles 'gainst a head

speaker: Fool
line: mouths in a glass.

line: No, I will be the pattern of all patience;

line: I will say nothing.

speaker: KENT
line: Who's there?

line: Marry, here's grace and a cod-piece; that's a wise

line: Alas, sir, are you here? things that love night

line: Love not such nights as these; the wrathful skies

line: Gallow the very wanderers of the dark,

line: And make them keep their caves: since I was man,

speaker: KENT
line: Such sheets of fire, such bursts of horrid thunder,

speaker: KENT
line: Such groans of roaring wind and rain, I never

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.

line: Remember to have heard: man's nature cannot carry

speaker: KENT
line: The affliction nor the fear.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Let the great gods,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: That keep this dreadful pother o'er our heads,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Find out their enemies now. Tremble, thou wretch,

line: That hast within thee undivulged crimes,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.

line: Unwhipp'd of justice: hide thee, thou bloody hand;

line: That art incestuous: caitiff, to pieces shake,

line: Hast practised on man's life: close pent-up guilts,

line: Rive your concealing continents, and cry

speaker: KENT
line: Alack, bare-headed!

line: My wits begin to turn.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.

line: Come on, my boy: how dost, my boy? art cold?

line: I am cold myself. Where is this straw, my fellow?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.

line: The art of our necessities is strange,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.

line: your hovel.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.

line: True, my good boy. Come, bring us to this hovel.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: This is a brave night to cool a courtezan.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: I'll speak a prophecy ere I go:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: When priests are more in word than matter;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: When brewers mar their malt with water;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: No heretics burn'd, but wenches' suitors;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: When every case in law is right;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: No squire in debt, nor no poor knight;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: When slanders do not live in tongues;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: Nor cutpurses come not to throngs;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: When usurers tell their gold i' the field;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: And bawds and whores do churches build;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: Then shall the realm of Albion

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: Come to great confusion:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: Then comes the time, who lives to see't,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool
line: That going shall be used with feet.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the heath. Storm still.
speaker: Fool

line: Here is the place, my lord; good my lord, enter:

line: Good my lord, enter here.

line: Wilt break my heart?

line: I had rather break mine own. Good my lord, enter.

line: Thou think'st 'tis much that this contentious storm

line: Invades us to the skin: so 'tis to thee;

line: But where the greater malady is fix'd,

line: But if thy flight lay toward the raging sea,

line: Thou'ldst meet the bear i' the mouth. When the

line: mind's free,

line: Is it not as this mouth should tear this hand

line: No, I will weep no more. In such a night

line: To shut me out! Pour on; I will endure.

speaker: KING LEAR
line: In such a night as this! O Regan, Goneril!

scene: SCENE IV.  The heath. Before a hovel.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Your old kind father, whose frank heart gave all,--

line: O, that way madness lies; let me shun that;

speaker: KENT
line: Good my lord, enter here.

line: Prithee, go in thyself: seek thine own ease:

line: This tempest will not give me leave to ponder

line: Nay, get thee in. I'll pray, and then I'll sleep.

line: Poor naked wretches, whereso'er you are,

scene: SCENE IV.  The heath. Before a hovel.

line: That bide the pelting of this pitiless storm,

line: How shall your houseless heads and unfed sides,

line: Your loop'd and window'd raggedness, defend you

scene: SCENE IV.  The heath. Before a hovel.

line: From seasons such as these? O, I have ta'en

line: Too little care of this! Take physic, pomp;

line: Expose thyself to feel what wretches feel,

line: That thou mayst shake the superflux to them,

line: Within  Fathom and half, fathom and half! Poor Tom!

line: Come not in here, nuncle, here's a spirit

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: He fastened on my neck, and bellow'd out

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: As he'ld burst heaven; threw him on my father;

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: Told the most piteous tale of Lear and him

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: That ever ear received: which in recounting

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: His grief grew puissant and the strings of life

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: Began to crack: twice then the trumpets sounded,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: And there I left him tranced.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: But who was this?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: Kent, sir, the banish'd Kent; who in disguise

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: Follow'd his enemy king, and did him service

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: Improper for a slave.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: Gentleman
line: Help, help, O, help!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: What kind of help?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Speak, man.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: What means that bloody knife?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: Gentleman
line: 'Tis hot, it smokes;

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: Gentleman
line: It came even from the heart of--O, she's dead!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Who dead? speak, man.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: Gentleman
line: Your lady, sir, your lady: and her sister

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: Gentleman
line: By her is poisoned; she hath confess'd it.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: I was contracted to them both: all three

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: Now marry in an instant.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: Here comes Kent.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Produce their bodies, be they alive or dead:

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: This judgment of the heavens, that makes us tremble,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Touches us not with pity.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: O, is this he?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: The time will not allow the compliment

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Which very manners urges.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: I am come

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: To bid my king and master aye good night:

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: Is he not here?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Great thing of us forgot!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Speak, Edmund, where's the king? and where's Cordelia?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: See'st thou this object, Kent?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: Alack, why thus?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: Yet Edmund was beloved:

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: The one the other poison'd for my sake,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: And after slew herself.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Even so. Cover their faces.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: I pant for life: some good I mean to do,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: Despite of mine own nature. Quickly send,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: Be brief in it, to the castle; for my writ

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: Is on the life of Lear and on Cordelia:

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: Nay, send in time.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Run, run, O, run!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: To who, my lord? Who hath the office? send

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: Thy token of reprieve.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: Well thought on: take my sword,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: Give it the captain.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Haste thee, for thy life.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: He hath commission from thy wife and me

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: To hang Cordelia in the prison, and

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: To lay the blame upon her own despair,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDMUND
line: That she fordid herself.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: The gods defend her! Bear him hence awhile.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Howl, howl, howl, howl! O, you are men of stones:

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Had I your tongues and eyes, I'ld use them so

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: That heaven's vault should crack. She's gone for ever!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I know when one is dead, and when one lives;

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: She's dead as earth. Lend me a looking-glass;

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: If that her breath will mist or stain the stone,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Why, then she lives.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: Is this the promised end

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: Or image of that horror?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Fall, and cease!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: This feather stirs; she lives! if it be so,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: It is a chance which does redeem all sorrows

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: That ever I have felt.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: Kneeling  O my good master!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Prithee, away.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: 'Tis noble Kent, your friend.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: A plague upon you, murderers, traitors all!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I might have saved her; now she's gone for ever!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Cordelia, Cordelia! stay a little. Ha!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: What is't thou say'st? Her voice was ever soft,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Gentle, and low, an excellent thing in woman.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I kill'd the slave that was a-hanging thee.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: Captain
line: 'Tis true, my lords, he did.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Did I not, fellow?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I have seen the day, with my good biting falchion

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I would have made them skip: I am old now,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: And these same crosses spoil me. Who are you?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Mine eyes are not o' the best: I'll tell you straight.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: If fortune brag of two she loved and hated,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: One of them we behold.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: This is a dull sight. Are you not Kent?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: The same,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: Your servant Kent: Where is your servant Caius?

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: He's a good fellow, I can tell you that;

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: He'll strike, and quickly too: he's dead and rotten.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: No, my good lord; I am the very man,--

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: I'll see that straight.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: That, from your first of difference and decay,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: Have follow'd your sad steps.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: You are welcome hither.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: Nor no man else: all's cheerless, dark, and deadly.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: Your eldest daughters have fordone them selves,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: And desperately are dead.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Ay, so I think.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: He knows not what he says: and vain it is

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: That we present us to him.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: Very bootless.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: Captain
line: Edmund is dead, my lord.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: That's but a trifle here.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: You lords and noble friends, know our intent.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: What comfort to this great decay may come

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Shall be applied: for us we will resign,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: During the life of this old majesty,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: To him our absolute power:

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: you, to your rights:

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: With boot, and such addition as your honours

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Have more than merited. All friends shall taste

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: The wages of their virtue, and all foes

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: The cup of their deservings. O, see, see!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: And my poor fool is hang'd! No, no, no life!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Why should a dog, a horse, a rat, have life,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: And thou no breath at all? Thou'lt come no more,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Never, never, never, never, never!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Pray you, undo this button: thank you, sir.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Do you see this? Look on her, look, her lips,

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KING LEAR
line: Look there, look there!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: He faints! My lord, my lord!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: Break, heart; I prithee, break!

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: Look up, my lord.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: Vex not his ghost: O, let him pass! he hates him much

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: That would upon the rack of this tough world

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: Stretch him out longer.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: EDGAR
line: He is gone, indeed.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: The wonder is, he hath endured so long:

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: He but usurp'd his life.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Bear them from hence. Our present business

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Is general woe.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Friends of my soul, you twain

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Rule in this realm, and the gored state sustain.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: I have a journey, sir, shortly to go;

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: KENT
line: My master calls me, I must not say no.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: The weight of this sad time we must obey;

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Speak what we feel, not what we ought to say.

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: The oldest hath borne most: we that are young

scene: SCENE III.  The British camp near Dover.
speaker: ALBANY
line: Shall never see so much, nor live so long.
